Key Match Events: The Cavaliers secured a 41-point lead in the first half with a score of 83-42.
The Cavs came up with a huge victory over the Warriors with a 136-117 finish.
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors came from a huge victory on Wednesday as Curry and the team dethroned the defending champions Boston Celtics in their homecourt. Coming into Cleveland, Golden State hopes to carry on their momentum as they try to beat the Cavs' undefeated 9-0 streak.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavs are now 10-0 in their season. As for the Warriors, it’s only their second defeat of the season, which is still impressive for a team that many believed wouldn’t be the same since Klay Thompson’s departure to Dallas.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Steph Curry was shut down by the Cavs as he was held down to 12 points and 25% accuracy from beyond the arc.
Jonathan Kuminga had a great game, putting up 21 points, six rebounds, and five assists.
Others: The Cavs' flurry of buckets rattled the Warriors, resulting in Cleveland securing the first quarter 39-22.
The Cavaliers did a good job stopping the Golden State Warriors’ main scorers as Curry, Buddy Hield, and Andrew Wiggins all struggled to gain momentum.
